result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John C Krumenacher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen. 
Case called along with:  15CM246, 15CM606, 15CM668 & 15CM722.

Matter is dismissed and read into cases:  15CM722, 15CM606 & 15CM246
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
